Another movie you might enjoy is "The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones" (2013), which combines fantasy elements with an action-packed plot centered around demons and warriors in New York City. The film stars Kevin Zegers and Aidan Turner.

Given your preference for a war genre film with an unexpected vibe, I'd highly recommend "Casablanca" (1942). Set in Morocco during World War II, this classic film features Humphrey Bogart and Claude Rains in an intriguing story about love, loyalty, and resistance against oppression.

If you're interested in a more contemporary take on existential issues, "I Heart Huckabees" (2004) might also appeal to you. Starring Dustin Hoffman and Lily Tomlin, it follows a team of investigators who help individuals unravel the complexities of life using their unique methods.
